commitResults.messageTitle: Rename main class and implement skeletal version
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot was previously using the placeholder name Duke.

Renamed the main class to Bingy to differentiate from other chatbots.
Add a greeting and exit message to establish a basic skeletal structure.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Bingy chatbot with greeting, echo, and exit
commitResults.messageBody:
Implement a version of Bingy where bot echos whatever user inputted and
exits gracefully when user inputs "bye".

Implementation previously contained the entire code within the main
class.

Separation of concerns help improve readability and makes it easier to
maintain code and add features in future

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to add task and list tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously chatbot only echos user input. To meet Level 2 requirements,
chatbot is now able to add task and list all tasks when user inputs
"list"

commitResults.messageTitle: Ability to mark tasks as done or not
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, taskList is just a string array. To fully support boolean
isDone for individual tasks, Task class is added and is encapsulated
within taskList.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for three types of tasks.
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously only one task type is supported. Now ToDo, Deadline, and
Event tasks are implemented. Abstract parent class task is implemented to
achieve inheritance of parent class of ToDo, Deadline, and Event tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Test using the I/O redirection technique
commitResults.messageBody: Automated testing for initiating different event types

Add error handling for invalid command input and empty deadline/event
timings. Previously unreadable long string of error message is thrown to
users, now error message is readable and provides action for users to
take to rectify input error.

Previously tasks cannot be deleted. Implement task deletion along with
error handling.

commitResults.messageTitle: Save lists and load them back
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously lists data not saved when user closes program. Now user list
data is parsed through a txt file and inputed to an ArrayList.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor parser into a separate component
Encapsulate LocalDate API into Deadline tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously deadline tasks stored deadlines as String. Deadline tasks now
store LocalDate as deadlines and Parser handles string and converts them
into LocalDate. Consequently, Storage now stores deadlines into ISO format
for loading deadline tasks, using an auxillary method toStorageString()
  in Deadline task class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Abstract out Ui components into Ui.java
Organize the classes into suitable java packages

commitResults.messageBody: Package app as an executable jar file for easy distribution.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix JavaDoc to follow coding standard
Add Assertions to main Bingy class
commitResults.messageBody:
Added Java `assert` statements in Bingy.java to document invariants and
internal assumptions that should always hold during execution. These include
checks after loading tasks, ensuring parser and command objects are not null,
validating task indices before access, and confirming task additions return
non-null results.
Add Assertions to main Bingy class

Changed boolean name from running to isRunning to comply with coding
standards.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add LocalDateTime support for Event tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
In order to fully support extension to allow users to view schedule,
Event tasks need to fully support LocalDateTime. Changed from String
from and to fields to LocalDateTime start and end fields.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add schedule view to display tasks by date
commitResults.messageBody:
- Implement TaskManager.getScheduleFor(LocalDate) to filter and sort timed tasks
- Add ViewCommand to support 'view' user command with optional date (defaults to today)
- Update Ui with showSchedule to render daily schedule
- Extend Parser to parse 'view' command and flexible date inputs
